snippet: After a year of siege, the city of Homs in central Syria may well be the site of the most concentrated destruction in the country.
abstract: City of Homs in central Syria may be site of most concentrated destruction in country after year of siege; several central areas have been gradually destroyed as they have changed hands several times between Syrian rebels and government forces.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and an EMPLOYEE of THE NEW YORK TIMES
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Homs, Syria. Hwaida Saad and Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: After a year of siege, the city of Homs in central Syria may well be the site of the most concentrated destruction in the country.

headline.main: Ruins in a Center of Syria’s Uprising
headline.print_headline: Ruins in a Center of Syria’s Uprising
